description: Smallest positive multiple of n containing only even digits.
links: Paul Tek, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: a(7) = 28 because among the multiples of 7, that is, 7, 14, 21, 28,... 28 is the smallest multiple with only even digits.
mathematica: Table[k = n; While[Length[Intersection[{1, 3, 5, 7, 9}, IntegerDigits[k]]] > 0, k = k + n]; k, {n, 100}] (* _T. D. Noe_, Jun 03 2013 *)
author: _Amarnath Murthy_, May 28 2001
extensions: Corrected and extended by Larry Reeves (larryr(AT)acm.org), May 29 2001
